slides.content: Explore GitHub's foundational concepts and its impact on collaborative software development.
slides.title: Welcome to GitHub Overview
slides.subtitle: Understanding GitHub's Role in Modern Software Development
slides.voiceover: Welcome to the GitHub Overview module. In this module, you'll learn about GitHub's role in modern software development and how it facilitates collaboration.

slides.content: GitHub is a web-based platform for version control and collaboration. It is used for tracking changes in source code during software development. It offers the distributed version control and source code management functionality of Git, plus its own features.
slides.title: What is GitHub?
slides.voiceover: GitHub is a web-based platform for version control and collaboration. It is used for tracking changes in source code during software development.

slides.title: Key Features of GitHub
slides.voiceover: GitHub offers several key features, including version control

slides.code:
# Initialize a new Git repository
git init

# Add files to the staging area
git add .

# Commit the changes with a message
git commit -m "Initial commit"
slides.title: Basic Git Commands - Part 1
slides.voiceover: Here are some basic Git commands to get you started. First, we initialize a new Git repository, add files to the staging area, and commit the changes with a message.

slides.code:
# Create a new branch
git branch feature/new-feature

# Switch to the new branch
git checkout feature/new-feature

# Push the branch to GitHub
git push origin feature/new-feature
slides.title: Basic Git Commands - Part 2
slides.voiceover: Next, we create a new branch, switch to the new branch, and push the branch to GitHub.

slides.question: What is GitHub?
slides.title: Quiz: What is GitHub?
slides.voiceover: Let's test your understanding. What is GitHub?

slides.content: The correct answer is: A web-based platform for version control and collaboration. GitHub provides tools for version control using Git, enabling multiple developers to work together on projects.
slides.title: Answer and Explanation
slides.voiceover: The correct answer is 'A web-based platform for version control and collaboration.' GitHub is not just a social media platform or a code editor; it's a comprehensive tool for managing and collaborating on code.

slides.content: GitHub facilitates collaborative software development through version control, issue tracking, and pull requests.
slides.title: Key Takeaways
slides.voiceover: To summarize, GitHub facilitates collaborative software development through version control, issue tracking, and pull requests.
